EXTRACTED VALUE: More of a biking "Project Gotham" than "Forza 2" - which is no bad thing. Thrilling. [Nov 2007, p.82]
WOTB: Commando 3 blends the gameplay of both of its predecessors and makes a good stand against the other arcade shooters on the marketplace.
It's arguably the most entertaining two-player sports game ever made.
If I were stranded on a deserted island, DDR Konamix would be the game I would want with me. [July 2002, p.89]
Complete with a unique visual scheme, engrossing story, and vibrant characters, the effect of Retro Helix will be felt for quite some time.
Capcom has done a brilliant job of changing the entire dynamics of how dinosaurs can be dealt with.
The animations are also really fluid and collisions look very natural, an area where Pro Evo is lacking.
Fails to build on the strengths of "Spider-Man 2" and take Spidey on to a whole new level. [June 2007, p.66]
While the midair stunts and crashes look painfully real, the game also seems to lack a convincing sensation of speed.
Solid gameplay, stunning aerial effects, but nothing that will have you celebrating. [Oct 2007, p.82]
I had a great time playing through it but with no online mode there is little reason to come back for more, other than the blood and breasts.
Ultimately this is an enjoyable package. If you can look beyond their relatively simplistic visuals then both games are worth investing some time in.
